definition: lit. to go into battle bare-breasted (idiom)/fig. to go all out/to come out in the open

sentences.english: You can wear NO shirt to a water park.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以打赤膊去水上樂園。

sentences.english: Misers put their back and their belly into their pockets.
sentences.chinese: 守財奴寧可打赤膊餓肚皮，也捨不得掏腰包。
誰該更多的赤膊上陣呢？

sentences.english: The head gangster, of course, cared nothing about being half-naked, and put off his underwear.
sentences.chinese: 強盜頭目當然不會在乎赤膊，於是就脫內衣。

sentences.english: Personally, I don't have a problem with shirtless runners in the hot weather.
sentences.chinese: 個人而言，對於那些大熱天赤膊跑步者我沒什麼意見。

sentences.english: Even more wreaks havoc from the Wall Street storm, high-level comes out into the open to various countries.
sentences.chinese: 從華爾街風暴愈加肆虐，到各國高層赤膊上陣。

sentences.english: Pictured is a male shirtless walk in the "Villages" in an alley.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲一男子赤膊走在“城中村”在一個小巷。

sentences.english: He always strips to the waist to show us his well-developed muscles.
sentences.chinese: 他總是打赤膊顯示給我們看他發達的肌肉。

sentences.english: It is illegal for men to go topless in the center of town.
sentences.chinese: 男人在市中心打赤膊是違法的。

sentences.english: The bandit certainly felt no shame in being half-naked . Then they stripped off their underclothes.
sentences.chinese: 強盜頭目當然不會在乎赤膊，於是就脫內衣。

definition: bare upper body/bare-chested/to bare one's chest
lit. to go into battle bare-breasted (idiom)/fig. to go all out/to come out in the open
waist of a bear and back of a tiger/tough and stocky build
